alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 30 at 4:10AM PST until December 03 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 feet around Stevens Pass and 1 to 3 feet around Washington Pass. Snow amounts of 2 to 6 inches in the Methow Valley. Wind gusting as high as 45 mph in the mountains. * WHERE...Winthrop, Loup Loup Pass, Twisp, Stehekin, Methow, Holden Village, Stevens Pass, Mazama, and Conconully. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions, especially at the mountain passes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest snow intensity is expected Friday Night into Saturday morning. Another burst of snow is possible for Washington Pass and the Methow Valley on Sunday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.

area.areaDesc: Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County
